As you can see, this is a tensor (continous variables) per row, and the last col is the target Category.

{% raw %} 
x_cols = df_train.columns[slice(0,-1)].to_list()
x_cols[0:5]

['att1', 'att2', 'att3', 'att4', 'att5']
{% endraw %}

Tabular based DL

This approach mimics the fastai V2 Tabular data model. It is a very ugly copy paste of the code, with the removal of the categorical variables.

{% raw %} 
from timeseries_fastai.tabular import *
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
df_main = stack_train_valid(df_train, df_test)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
df_main.head()
att1 att2 att3 att4 att5 att6 att7 att8 att9 att10 ... att1017 att1018 att1019 att1020 att1021 att1022 att1023 att1024 target valid_col

5 rows × 1026 columns

{% endraw %}

We build a TSPandas object that is very very similar to the TabularPandas from fastai2.tabular.core

{% raw %} 
splits = [range_of(df_train), list(range(len(df_train), len(df_main)))]
to = TSPandas(df_main, Normalize, x_names=x_cols, y_names='target', splits=splits)
{% endraw %}

We build the DataLoaders:

{% raw %} 
dls = to.dataloaders(32, 128)
{% endraw %}

My very basic performance test to cycle the dls

{% raw %} 
def cycle_dl(dl):
    for x,y in iter(dl):
        pass
{% endraw %}

We will benchmark the valid set that has 8000 items:

{% raw %} 
len(dls.valid_ds)

8236
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
%time cycle_dl(dls.valid)

CPU times: user 1.41 s, sys: 24.1 ms, total: 1.43 s
Wall time: 122 ms
{% endraw %}

Row by Row pandas DataLoader

Here we define a more fastaish approch, where we construct a new class for timeseries called TSeries, and we sue the TSDataLoaders to build our data. This is defined on the notebook 01 from this repo. It is a very simple DataBlock build method, the underlying data source is a pandas DataFrame that we ingest row by row

{% raw %} 
from timeseries_fastai.data import *
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
tsdls = TSDataLoaders.from_dfs(df_train, df_test, x_cols=x_cols, label_col='target', bs=32, val_bs=128)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
%time cycle_dl(tsdls.valid)

CPU times: user 81.8 ms, sys: 290 ms, total: 371 ms
Wall time: 1.79 s
{% endraw %}

it is very slow.

Naive approach

Following Radek, let's build this from scratch on the most simple possible way.

{% raw %} 
tfl = TfmdLists(df_test, [noop])
tfl[0]

att1      -0.569701
att2      -0.567901
att3      -0.565901
att4      -0.563701
att5      -0.561501
             ...   
att1021   -0.543001
att1022   -0.548501
att1023   -0.554501
att1024   -0.560801
target         b'2'
Name: 0, Length: 1025, dtype: object
{% endraw %}

extract the x:

{% raw %} 
def get_x(row): return row.values[:1024].astype(np.float32)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
get_x(df_test.iloc[0])

array([-0.56970096, -0.56790096, -0.565901  , ..., -0.5485009 ,
       -0.55450094, -0.56080097], dtype=float32)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
tfl = TfmdLists(df_main, [get_x])
tfl[0]

array([0.5373029 , 0.53110296, 0.52850294, ..., 0.52640295, 0.51950294,
       0.51140296], dtype=float32)
{% endraw %}

extract y:

{% raw %} 
def get_y(row): return row.values[1024]
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
get_y(df_test.iloc[0])

b'2'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
tfl_y = TfmdLists(df_test, [get_y])
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
tfl_y[0]

b'2'
{% endraw %}

let's check this:

{% raw %} 
%time tfl_y = TfmdLists(df_test, [get_y])

CPU times: user 1.15 ms, sys: 0 ns, total: 1.15 ms
Wall time: 1.15 ms
{% endraw %}

SLOW: It is the Categorize setup:

{% raw %} 
%time tfl_y = TfmdLists(df_test, [get_y, Categorize])

CPU times: user 3.39 s, sys: 57 ms, total: 3.45 s
Wall time: 3.35 s
{% endraw %}

Let's check the Pipeline

{% raw %} 
cat = Categorize()
cat.setup(L(get_y(row) for index, row in df_test.iterrows()))
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
pipe = Pipeline([get_y, cat])
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
%time _ =[pipe(df_test.iloc[i]) for i in range_of(df_test)]

CPU times: user 3.97 s, sys: 41.3 ms, total: 4.01 s
Wall time: 3.88 s
{% endraw %}

Two tfmdLists stacked together, A Dataset

{% raw %} 
ds = Datasets(df_test, [[get_x], [get_y,Categorize]])
ds[0]

(array([-0.56970096, -0.56790096, -0.565901  , ..., -0.5485009 ,
        -0.55450094, -0.56080097], dtype=float32),
 TensorCategory(1))
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
dl = DataLoader(ds, bs=128)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
%time cycle_dl(dl)

CPU times: user 7.45 s, sys: 6.88 ms, total: 7.46 s
Wall time: 7.46 s
{% endraw %}
